title.narrative: Red Cross Denmark - NGO call Sahel - 2020-20255

description.narrative: Red Cross Denmark - NGO call Sahel - 2020-2025 - The project will contribute to the protection and resilience of displaced persons and host communities in vulnerable situations through humanitarian assistance and sustainable inclusive solutions for livelihood and social cohesion in selected regions of Mali and Niger.

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Resilience of displaced persons and host community members in vulnerable situations is strengthened through equitable and sustainable access to livelihoods opportunities and capacity building of local actors including RCRC

2.1 % of people who have received livelihoods support report feeling more economically resilient as a result of programme activities and services
2.2 % of households that have increased their level of income
2.3 % of people (RC staff and volunteers and other participants) who report increased knowledge or skills as a result of receiving capacity building support

target.value:
2.1. 80% report feeling more economically resilient as a result of programme activities and services
2.2 50% of households have increased their income level
2.3 80% report increased knowledge as a result of receiving capacity building support

title.narrative: Social cohesion within and between displaced persons and host communities is strengthened in the target area

3.1 % of the people (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) who report experiencing tensions or conflicts
3.2 % of the people (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) that report feeling safer as a result of the social cohesion activities
3.3 % of beneficiaries who report being able to engage actively in decision making processes

target.value: End target is set at 70% for all indicators by the end of the project.

title.narrative: Displaced persons and host community members in vulnerable situations have their basic needs met in a dignified manner in Bamako, Gao, Tillaberi and Niamey

1.1 % targeted beneficiaries (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) reporting that the assistance received has met their specific needs, disaggregated by age, gender and disability
1.2 % targeted beneficiaries (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) that report enhanced wellbeing as a result of programme health and PSS activities and services, disaggregated by age, gender and disability
1.3 % targeted beneficiaries (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) that report feeling safer as a result of programme protection activities and services, disaggregated by age, gender and disability
1.4 % of people (IDPs, refugees and host communities’ members) aware of available services, disaggregated by age, gender and disability

target.value: The end target is set at 90% for the indicators 1.1- 1.4 by the end of project

title.narrative: Community engagement and accountability, learning and research ensure relevant, responsive and sustainable actions for displaced persons and host communities

3.3.1 # of DIIS studies carried out in Mali and Niger to generate evidence on protection needs for displaced living in urban areas of Bamako and Niamey
3.3.2 # complaint and feedback mechanisms set up in the programme
3.3.3 # of learning notes made by the programme

target.value: 6 DIIS reports finalised and disseminated among key programme partners and stakeholders. Complaints and feedback mechanisms functional in the project areas providing information for programme adaptation One learning note elaborated and shared with key programme partners and stakeholders

4 DIIS reports finalised and disseminated among key programme partners and stakeholders. Complaints and feedback mechanisms functional in the project areas providing information for programme adaptation One learning note elaborated and shared with key programme partners and stakeholders

4 DIIS reports finalised and disseminated among key programme partners and stakeholders. Complaints and feedback mechanisms functional in the project areas providing information for programme adaptation One learning note elaborated and shared with key programme partners and stakeholders

4 DIIS studies planned and initiated. Feedback mechanisms for beneficiaries elaborated, set up and tested in the two countries. Complaint management committee’s set-up with NS senior management in the two countries
